column4: anyone able to help me with /etc/wpa_supplicant.conf ?  What's "psk" for example? Been trying to bring my wireless up forever.. "dmesg | grep ipw" shows some good signs at least now
it's an ipw2200bg
psk is a short for "passkey"
and if I have no idea what it is? :)
do you need a passkey to connect to your router?
don't think so.. I'm at a univerity, and I think I'd hear about it if so
I leave it blank, remove it or something?
no idea. have no wifi here. have you read the wireless wiki?
I've read lots of stuff.. had this thing over a year without being able to connect lol
I got through this one, that's basically where I'm at right now: http://www.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=26623
getting the conf file done right is the last part of that howto
haha, just found the same one
I have Network controller: Intel Corp. PRO/Wireless 2200BG (rev 05)
yes, it is supported it seems. start here https://wiki.ubuntu.com/WiFiHowto
will do
thanks for the help, looks like I have some reading to do! :)
np, let me know if you succeed :)
i thought your card was supported without ndiswrapper...?
gave up
i have up on the normal stuff cause it says "no wireless extensions." all over the plate, with no instructions other than pointing to ndiswrapper
sorry, i'm not the person to ask for help. you emptied my limited knowledge in that area :)
okay.. guess I'll just leave it alone.. wireless in linux sux! :)  not linux' fault though, I guess
